questions.text: Theo was raised in what town?
questions.explanation:
Dorning.

	Theo was an orphan.  Dorning prided itself on taking care of its orphans.

questions.text: Theo was the apprentice of a printer.  He was also called the printer's _____.
questions.explanation:
devil.

	I am not sure if Alexander invented the phrase 'printer's devil' or if it actually describes a printer's apprentice.

questions.text: What is the name of Theo's master, the printer?
questions.explanation:
Anton.

	He is one of the best printers in Westmark.

questions.text: Under what name does Count Las Bombas want his pamphlet printed?
questions.explanation:
Dr. Absalom

	Dr. Absolom claims to have cures for all sorts of ailments.  He is, of course, a fraud.  Las Bombas also uses the alias Mynheer Bloomsa later in the book.

questions.text: Who is the constable who warns Theo that the police are searching for him, and lets him escape?
questions.explanation:
Constable Pohn.

	He tells Theo that they will search the forest, and hints that he should escape via the King's Highway.

questions.text: When the soldiers come into the print shop, Theo hits the officer on the head with an iron bar.  Does the officer die?
questions.explanation:
No.

	It was a Royal Officer, so Theo was soon in trouble with not only the local constabulary, but the Crown police as well.

questions.text: What prop in Las Bombas' show unexpectedly begins interacting with him?
questions.explanation:
The phrenological head.

	Mickle was hiding under the coach and projecting her voice.

questions.text: What is the name of Las Bombas' horse?
questions.explanation:
Friska.

	She escapes, but Theo steals her and unwittingly returns her to Las Bombas.

questions.text: Theo and Mickle make a deal.  He teaches her to read and write.  What does she teach him in return?
questions.explanation:
Sign language.

	She turns out to be a better student than he does.

questions.text: Who does Skeit claim to be when he meets Las Bombas?
questions.explanation:
An alderman.

	He is complete with fur cloak and gold chain.

questions.text: Las Bombas tells Skeit that he knows what craft?
questions.explanation:
Alchemy.

	He tells Skeit that if they put their money together in a bag overnight it will multiply.  Of course, his intentions are not so honorable.

questions.text: Las Bombas is successful in stealing Skeit's money.
questions.explanation:
False.

	When he thinks Skeit is asleep, he goes outside to collect pebbles, which he will switch with the money.  However, when he is gone, Skeit switches the money with leaden disks.  Las Bombas' own plot backfired.

questions.text: After Theo leaves Las Bombas, what alias does he assume?
questions.explanation:
De Roth.

	He becomes a public letter-writer.

questions.text: The police do not arrest Florian because they are afraid of a mob uprising.
questions.explanation:
False.

	They are afraid of Florian himself.

questions.text: What does Stock, the poet, want to name the cobbled-together printing press?
questions.explanation:
The Westmark Phoenix.

	The phoenix rises from its own ashes, and the printing press rose from the remains of others.

questions.text: To whose health do Florian and his children drink to in Jellinek's tavern?
questions.explanation:
Cabbarus.

	However, they never mentioned good health.

questions.text: Florian is described as ___________ than Theo.
questions.explanation:
not much older.

	He exerts a presence far beyond his age, however.

questions.text: Why does Skeit capture Las Bombas and company?
questions.explanation:
To take them to Cabbarus.

	Cabbarus wanted them to pretend to raise the spirit of the king's dead daughter.

questions.text: "Old Karsperl" is a popular comic journal.  What is the name of its author?
questions.explanation:
Keller.

	"Old Kasperl" is a satire of Westmark politics and social goings-on.  Its main characters are Old Kasperl and the Bear.  Keller lives in the Fingers, the marshes at the mouth of the Vespera River, with the two "water rats," Weasel and Sparrow.

questions.text: What is Cabbarus' fate at the end?
questions.explanation:
He is exiled.

	Theo saved him from falling to his death in the belltower.  He later asked the king that Cabbarus be exiled and not killed.
